definition: to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
one who does not fear the death of thousand cuts will dare to unhorse the emperor (proverb)/to a fearless person, no fence is high enough
pinyin: she3 de5 yi1 shen1 gua3 , gan3 ba3 huang2 di4 la1 xia4 ma3
containing_words.word: 舍得一身剐，敢把皇帝拉下马

sentences.english: He got up and strode to the door.
sentences.chinese: 在他下马之前，我走去开门。

sentences.english: Cossack got off his horse, lifted the boy down, and came with him to Denisov.
sentences.chinese: 那个哥萨克把孩子抱下马，把他带到杰尼索夫跟前。

sentences.english: The horse twisted and bucked and finally dismounted its rider.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马扭动并猛然弓背跃起把骑手摔下马。

sentences.english: Having pulled up his home he dismounted and walked up to us.
sentences.chinese: 他勒住马缰绳，然后下马向我们走来。

sentences.english: The drill sergeant begins by putting the fear of God up every new recruit .
sentences.chinese: 这个教练军士一开始就给全体新兵一个下马威。

sentences.english: They unharnessed the horses and turned them out to grass.
sentences.chinese: 他们解下马具，把马赶出去吃草。

sentences.english: He sat down at the side of the road and wrote a telegram to Secretary Stanton.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速下马，在路边坐下，给斯坦顿写了份电报。

sentences.english: I helped the trembling child off the horse and into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我把战战惊惊的孩子扶下马，陪他进了房子。

sentences.english: Forced dismounts do not provoke opportunity attacks.
sentences.chinese: 强迫下马不会引起机会攻击。

sentences.english: He dismounted and helped Uxbridge down and then returned to the business of beating the French.
sentences.chinese: 他跳下马，扶阿克斯布里奇下来，回头就再战法军。

sentences.english: The dwarf jumped off and ran toward the shield.
sentences.chinese: 侏儒跳下马往盾的方向跑去。

sentences.english: I helped the trembling child off the horse and into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我把战战惊惊的孩子扶下马，陪他进了房子。

sentences.english: Half a li from the hermitage they dismounted as a sign of respect. Approaching on foot, they met Zhuge Jun.
sentences.chinese: 离草庐半里之外，玄德便下马步行，正遇诸葛均。

sentences.english: He is in is discontinued with by the replace is a new boyfriend's edge.
sentences.chinese: 他是在被下马和被替换为一个新男朋友的边缘。

sentences.english: Knocking Liverpool off their fucking perch is my greatest achievement.
sentences.chinese: 曼联家老头曾说把利物浦拉下马是我一生最大的成就。

definition: to get on a horse/to mount
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
horseback
Malaya/Malaysia
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
reins
warhorse
saddle
soldier/noncommssioned officer (NCO)
ordinary soldier
to come close/to get near to/front
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
soldier/private (army)
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
to urge on a horse by patting its bottom/fig. to encourage/same as 拍馬屁|拍马屁, to flatter or toady
